q_en: What is the production progress of the Dress ordered by Emily? Please represent it in percentage.
gt:
Sure! Let's dive into the production progress of the dresses ordered by Emily. üéâ

Based on the data, here's a breakdown of the production progress:

| Order Product ID | Total Number of Dresses | Completed Dresses |
|------------------|-------------------------|-------------------|
| 11               | 140                     |                   |
| 12               | 150                     |                   |
| 13               | 130                     |                   |
| 14               | 120                     |                   |
| **Total**        | **540**                 | **460**           |

To calculate the production progress in percentage, we use the formula:

\[ \text{Progress (\%)} = \left( \frac{\text{Completed Dresses}}{\text{Total Number of Dresses}} \right) \times 100 \]

So, the production progress is:

\[ \text{Progress (\%)} = \left( \frac{460}{540} \right) \times 100 \approx 85.19\% \]

Emily's dresses are about 85.19% complete! Almost there! ü•≥

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM customers WHERE customer_name = 'Emily';
steps.description: Retrieve the customer ID for the customer with the name "Emily"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM orders WHERE user_id = '3';
steps.description: Retrieve the order IDs for orders placed by the customer "Emily"

steps.sql: SELECT id FROM products WHERE products_type_id = (SELECT id FROM products_types WHERE description = 'Dress');
steps.description: Retrieve the product IDs for products of type "Dress"

steps.sql: SELECT id, number FROM order_product WHERE order_id IN (3, 11) AND product_id IN (5, 13, 21, 29);
steps.description: Retrieve the order_product IDs and the total number of products for the specific orders and product type "Dress"

steps.sql: SELECT SUM(completed_number) FROM sewing_tasks WHERE order_product_id IN (11, 12, 13, 14);
steps.description: Retrieve the total completed quantity of all sewing tasks for the specific order_products
